name: Le Meridien Atlanta Perimeter

reviews.text: I recently stayed at Le Meridien on business. It was clean, well equipped and in a good location for work. The service was very good and staff were attentive and friendly. The hotel itself was a little expensive and the breakfast was disappointing; I opted for McDonald's across the car park!!
reviews.title: Quality Hotel

reviews.text: My family and I enjoyed our weekend stay at the Le Meridien. We had a double king bed suite! The rooms and overall upkeep of the hotel was excellent, despite the ongoing construction. The staff was very nice and helpful and the rooms were of great size and comfort! The location (Perimeter) was ideal. Not too close, not too far from downtown Atlanta (Peachtree St/Buckhead area). Any and everything you need is right around the hotel, within walking distance (shopping, groceries, restaurants, etc.)... I'd definitely recommend this hotel!!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took great care in finding the perfect hotel for a recent getaway with my boyfriend this past weekend. We have both stayed in countless Starwood hotels but never a Le Meridien property so I was very excited to see that a new one had opened in Atlanta. I also author a lifestyle blog and was looking forward to sharing my experience with my readers. Unfortunately, I don't have as many positives to share as I was hoping for.
reviews.title: Had High Hope For This Place....

reviews.text: Check-in: "Sanja" at the front desk was friendly but did not want to accommodate my request for a higher room. On my reservation, I requested a room on a high floor, and away from the elevator. She first offered a 3rd floor suite which I asked her to change. We then were placed in a 5th floor suite, right next to the elevator and overlooking a parking lot! Not good enough especially when I later learned that the hotel was only at 40% occupancy for the weekend.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: The Suite: The bedroom and living room were VERY spacious. We enjoyed the extra room however the bathroom was ridiculously small and cramped. The water pressure was acceptable however the A/C unit in our room sounded like it was going to blow every time we adjusted the temperature. It literally sounded like a car was rattling around in our room which made it very difficult to sleep. The bed was a bit too stiff for my liking.
reviews.title: Great Hotel if in Atlanta, Ga.
Lovely hotel
reviews.text: This is the former "W" Hotel at the Atlanta Perimeter Center that has recently reopened as Le Meridien. The hotel is finished to a high standard and very convenient to the Perimeter Center and companies based around there. Room was very spacious. One negative on the room was that the air conditioner was very noisy and I had to turn it off in order to get to sleep. I then woke up too hot in the night! Food was very good albeit expensive. We ended up being there for the reopening party and were treated to lots of delicious canapés and champagne in the lobby bar area! All in all a pleasant stay and I would stay again.

The rooms on the 10th floor are spacious and all the décor is well appointed and clean. What sets this hotel apart from any other however is the service - specifically the service I received from Nelly at the front desk. I was not feeling well and had gone to the desk in search of advil. She was empathetic and helped me right away so that I could quickly return to my meeting. At 8:30pm I received a call from in room dining asking if it was alright for them to deliver an amenity. A few minutes later I received a card, a piece of chocolate (delicious cake) and hot tea. In the card was another packet of advil and a note from Nelly hoping I was feeling better. Her thoughtfulness was so touching especially so far from home - I was blown away. In fact everyone whom I have spoken with since this has occurred on Monday has heard my story!
reviews.title: Blown away by the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whatever you are doing here keep doing it! I also had good experiences with the bartender Mon night (female), the banquet attendant (innovation room), the in room dining staff, and my room attendant (who when she saw me walking down the hall pressed the elevator button for me and asked how my stay was addressing me BY NAME). It takes a lot to impress me as I travel a lot - but I was definitely impressed
reviews.title: Wonderful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this property as our Host Hotel for our wedding prior to the renovations....and wow, we were blown away with how awesome it turned out! The rooms are amazing and beautiful...the views are spectacular and the service was great. The only Hiccup was the lawn service running their leaf blowers at 7am for two hours, but the property is adjusting this practice to start after 10am instead. The location was great with food within walking distance (Seasons 52 is a great place and just across the street!) and it was accessible to guests taking the MARTA and was close to our venue. They also have airport shuttle service and MARTA shuttle service (I believe, might want to double check)
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!

reviews.text: We love Starwood, in general, the W and Le Meridian being our favorites....but so far this is the nicest property we've stayed at. (And I'm in hotels nearly every week!) Thanks to the staff for helping make a memorable experience!
reviews.title: Big Modern Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spend a night away at the Atlanta Perimeter Le Meridian. The decor of the hotel common areas and rooms were fresh and modern. Check-in staff was very nice and upgraded us to a suite since it was our anniversary. I was impressed that the check-in staff took the time time to come around the desk and personally thank us for staying and hand us the key cards,
reviews.title: Most comfortable room ever!

reviews.text: The hallways on the room floors where quiet and nicely designed. The ceiling of the hallway was arched with lighting along the sides. Upgraded carpet and dark wood-like covering on the walls was so cool.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The room key card is RFID enable and just has to be touched to the black pad on the door.
reviews.title: Great stay at this hotel

reviews.text: The suite was amazing! Probably 700 sqft. large L shaped couch, long high topped desk behind the couch with a wide window behind the desk. There was also a large table with 2 chairs and a two-person bench. The TV in the living area was at least 60".
reviews.title: Excellent Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom was separated from the living area by a lockable door. The bedroom had a large king sized bed, sitting chair, 50" TV. The furniture was top notch with very interesting lighting throughout the room. The bedroom also had a large armoire. The bathroom was ok, not as upgraded was the rest of the suite but clean and well equipped.
reviews.title: Impressive!

reviews.text: We were very impressed with our stay at this hotel. First, the customer service is the best we have had in a very long time. The wake up calls are even personal here. No automated stuff! The rooms are huge with two big flat screen tv's (one 60 inch), a living room with a huge couch, desk, an eating area with a table that seats six, and a bedroom with two king size beds with the most comfortable mattresses. The only complaint that I had was that the wi-fi is not free in the rooms, but you can go to the lobby and get free wi-fi. But for only $100 dollars a night, I can't really complain about that. I'm not the mall type, but if you are, then you will enjoy the Perimeter Mall across the street. We were in town for a Braves game and was able to make it to Turner Field within 20 minutes or so. Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Highly Recommend!

reviews.text: This hotel is a great property and one of my favorite hotels. The rooms are enormous, gym is great, wonderful SPG lounge and good restaurants in the surrounding area. This hotel may not be in an ideal location for those who want lots of nightlife, but it is perhaps for business travelers or those who want a relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: From the moment we checked it here was a wonderful suite couple of ladies at the desk who were just delightful - I think 1 was getting off - but just awesome / if they read this it was around 3pm on the 21st wish I had gotten names. Sufficed to say have stayed in Buckhead countless times and our stay here - from the size of the room to the staff to the - cleanliness - everything was an A plus - highly recommend
reviews.title: Friendly Staff Super Suite

reviews.text: I enjoyed my recent visit to this hotel. The decor is modern and very comfortable. Rooms are spacious and well appointed with whimsical touches. All staff I encountered were genuinely friendly and helpful. The neighborhood is one of the best in Atlanta, with great shopping and dining options. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Comfortable luxury near Perimeter Mall

reviews.text: Once again they have updated this W property. It's a very nice, sleek and modern design. The staff is definitely updated as well. Professional and courteous front desk, great bartender in the lobby bar. The hotel is a good deal at 135 or so a night. Parking is 10 bucks and they have a shuttle. For what you would get charged to stay at the business traveler hotels like Hilton Garden inn, Country Inn and Suites or Embassy Suites..all in the immediate area, I think this is better. It's not fancy though..no bellman or valet. The breakfast looked like the very routine buffet all the business travel places had and it was not included. A cup of coffee to go was a pricey 5$. There are these very cool in room expresso machines but they require a PHd in engineering to operate..I own two k cup machines and still couldn't figure the thing out. Overall the hotel feels like utilitarian semi-luxury. I think some tiny little additions, like fresh flowers in the lobby, warm snacks at happy hour, free morning coffee or cookies laid out in the evening could put this place ahead of competition.
reviews.title: Basic but nice....a good deal....

description: A Connected Getaway: Adjacent to Perimeter Mall, Le Meridien Atlanta Perimeter is set in the heart of Dunwoody, minutes from downtown Atlanta via car or MARTA. The surrounding area is a contemporary juxtaposition of business, shopping, dining, sports, and entertainment. Modern Indulgences: The spacious, well-lit foyer exemplifies the stylish clean lines throughout the hotel. The gym and pool help guests unwind, world-class cuisine is served at our inviting restaurant, and our event space accommodates transformative experiences. Individual Comforts: Our 275 oversized guest rooms and suites feature bold blue and white decor with natural wood accents. All offer wireless High Speed Internet Access to keep you connected to home and the office, and some have two king-size beds for your convenience.
